availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, Attorney. Kentucky native. Father of Jeanne Blackburn, Kate M. Blackburn, Amanda Blackburn, Julia Blackburn, James Blackburn, and Mary Blackburn. Married to Elizabeth H. Blackburn. Attorney in Warren County, Kentucky in 1850. Owned 15 enslaved persons in Warren County, Kentucky in 1850. Attorney in Warren County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned 17 enslaved persons in Warren County, Kentucky in 1860. Nominated clerk of Circuit and County Courts in Warren County, Kentucky by Provisional Government of Kentucky on December 29, 1861.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 119.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 577.Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 458 & 459.Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 4.Find A Grave, "Samuel Davies Blackburn (May 14, 1807-June 6, 1808)," Memorial #37058345, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/37058345 (accessed January 26, 2020. KYR-0004-033-0038.
